meanings.definition: To give intellectual, moral, and social instruction to someone.
meanings.sent1: Parents play a crucial role in educating their children at home.
meanings.sent2: Teachers are responsible for educating students in various subjects.
meanings.sent3: The talking dog was educating the audience on proper pet care.
meanings.sent4: The wise old owl was educating the young birds on how to hunt for food.
meanings.sent5: The interactive museum exhibit was educating visitors about ancient civilizations.

meanings.definition: To provide knowledge or training to someone.
meanings.sent1: Online courses are a convenient way of educating people from different locations.
meanings.sent2: The workshop aims at educating participants on new techniques in gardening.
meanings.sent3: The robot was educating the astronauts on how to operate the spacecraft.
meanings.sent4: The mentor was educating the apprentice in the art of woodworking.
meanings.sent5: The documentary was educating viewers about the impact of climate change.

meanings.definition: To develop the faculties and powers of someone by teaching.
meanings.sent1: Regular practice is essential for educating the mind and improving memory.
meanings.sent2: The coach is dedicated to educating athletes on proper techniques for success.
meanings.sent3: The magician was educating the young audience on the secrets behind his tricks.
meanings.sent4: Nature has a way of educating us about the cycle of life and growth.
meanings.sent5: Books have the power of educating readers on different cultures and perspectives.
